formattedAddress: Pier 25 Hudson River, Park, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: Pier 25 Hudson River, Park, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: This seasonal oyster bar on the deck of a historic fishing boat serves seafood entrees & drinks.

originalText.text:
Its a walk from the road but worth it. Went here just before the lunch rush and got myself a seat at the bar. Ordered a dozen oysters and the lobster rolls. Both were good and very tasty.

Had a watermelon cocktail and that was amazing too.

Service was great and servers very attentive.

The only downside is coming here when the water is too choppy as the boat definitely rocks. So if you get seasick easily, take a motion sickness tablet before coming here.

originalText.text: Absolutely love this spot! The oysters are fresh and the food is good. Great service. This is a bonus on top of the beautiful scenes of being on a boat in soho with stunning views of the buildings and water.

text.text: Absolutely love this spot! The oysters are fresh and the food is good. Great service. This is a bonus on top of the beautiful scenes of being on a boat in soho with stunning views of the buildings and water.

originalText.text: I brought my husband here for his birthday on a Sunday afternoon. I reserved seats at the bar.  Keep in mind not all areas of the boat are under shade so be aware that you may need to wear your strongest spf.  The boat is beautiful and our server was great. We really enjoyed each dish. We got oysters and the cocktail shrimp, it was all divine.  For our entrees we ordered the scallops and the Steelhead. Both were delicious but my favorite was the Steelhead trout.   I’d recommend this restaurant not only does it have a nice ambiance but the food is pretty great if you like seafood.

text.text: I brought my husband here for his birthday on a Sunday afternoon. I reserved seats at the bar. I’d recommend this restaurant not only does it have a nice ambiance but the food is pretty great if you like seafood.

originalText.text: Amazing view and great vibes! However drinks were not great at all not sure if it was an off day for the bartender or what but we had quite a few cocktails and they were all disappointing. Oysters were delicious but a bit on the pricey side considering the location and view I would say it was worth it. The lobster roll was absolutely delicious but so tiny even for one person. I would recommend going for the experience, ambiance and views but not for drinks. Also, reservation is a must as they tend to be really busy with a time limit for each table.

originalText.text: One of my favourite dining experience anywhere. When you dine at Grand Banks, you are eating on a ship that is docked at the pier. The atmosphere is nautical and authentic. Grabbing oysters, seafood and drinks here is always a good time!
